name: 4-{(2E)-3-[4-(dimethylamino)phenyl]prop-2-enoyl}phenyl 2-methoxybenzoate
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1123
Reason: 4-{(2E)-3-[4-(dimethylamino)phenyl]prop-2-enoyl}phenyl has a melting point of approximately 100°C due to the presence of a phenyl group, which increases the melting point due to its ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. The dimethylamino group also contributes to the melting point due to its ability to form hydrogen bonds, which can raise it by approximately +10°C. The methoxy group can also contribute to the melting point due to its ability to form hydrogen bonds, which can raise it by approximately +5°C.
